snippet: The pardon of Ramil Safarov by the president of Azerbaijan has caused tension with Armenia, the home country of the serviceman that Mr. Safarov killed eight years ago.
abstract: Pardon of Azerbaijani man Ramil Safarov by Pres Illham H Aliyev has again raised tensions with Armenia, the home country of the serviceman who was brutally murdered by Safarov in 2004; backlash has embarrassed Hungary, which agreed to extradite Safarov on the assumption that he would serve at least 25 years of a life sentence.

byline.contributor: Shahla Sultanova contributed reporting from Baku, Azerbaijan.

lead_paragraph: The pardon of Ramil Safarov by the president of Azerbaijan has caused tension with Armenia, the home country of the serviceman that Mr. Safarov killed eight years ago.

headline.main: A Hero’s Welcome for a Convicted Killer Reignites Tensions
headline.print_headline: A Hero’s Welcome for a Convicted Killer Reignites Azerbaijan-Armenia Tensions
